module.title: Server: System Log
module.description:
System component for logging and mailing exceptions.
OUTDATED: Use modules Server:Log:Exception instead!
! END OF LIFE ! ---------------
**Features:** list> - stores exceptions into log file - tries to serialize exception - otherwise stores trace - can send mails to one or more mail receivers - provides views to list and display logged exceptions <list
**Invokation:** code> ... catch( Exception $e ){ $this->env->getCaptain()->callHook( 'Server:System', 'logException', $this, array( 'exception' => $e ) ); } ... <code
**Fallback:** Calling the hook Env::logException will also trigger the event if not handled by any other hooks before: code> $this->env->getCaptain()->callHook( 'Env', 'logException', $this, array( 'exception' => $e ) ); <code
If you are sure, that this module is installed, you can use: code> ... catch( Exception $e ){ Controller_System_Log::handleException( $e ); } ... <code Of course, this method is not the best way, since you bind your code to this module. Please think about using the hook instead.
